title: Patriots vs. Dolphins live updates: Will New England drop to 0-2?
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots quarterback Drake Maye looks to rebound after a loss against the Raiders as they face the Dolphins in Miami.
New England has lost five straight games in Miami; quarterback Maye remains the only active player from the 2024 draft class.
Miami Dolphins, coming off a 33-8 loss to the Colts, face Patriots despite recent team turmoil and a players-only meeting.

title: Years in the making, Quincy’s new MBTA parking garage opens Monday
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: The North Quincy MBTA station opens a new parking garage with 1,500 spaces on September 15, 2025.
The garage construction began in February 2019 to replace the previous surface-level lot at 189 Hancock St.
Daily parking rates are $5 on weekdays and $3 on weekends, with payment via the PayByPhone app.

title: N.H. leads 25 states in seeking Supreme Court review of ‘unconstitutional’ Mass. gun law
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: New Hampshire leads 25 Republican-led states urging Supreme Court review of Massachusetts' gun law affecting out-of-state visitors.
The dispute involves Pheasant Lane Mall, where crossing state lines could violate Massachusetts gun laws without appropriate permits.
Phillip Marquis' previous legal challenge was denied; the Massachusetts court upheld nonresident firearms licensing under Second Amendment.

title: Dua Lipa loved this North End restaurant so much she went there twice
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Dua Lipa visited Neptune Oyster and The Red Fox in Boston during her 'Radical Optimism' tour.
Lipa enjoyed a lobster roll at Neptune Oyster so much that she returned for a second visit.
The Red Fox, a new Italian restaurant in the North End, served Dua Lipa martinis on her visit.

title: 2025 Emmys predictions: Who will win, who will get snubbed
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 2025 Emmy predictions show 'Severance,' 'Adolescence,' and 'The Studio' as likely winners.
Potential snubs include 'Andor' for Best Drama and Britt Lower in Best Actress (Drama).
Emmy telecast will air on CBS and stream on Paramount+ at 8 p.m. Sunday.

title: Alex Bregman shares his advice for younger Red Sox teammates down the stretch
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Alex Bregman advises young Red Sox players to simplify their game as the season's end approaches.
Boston Red Sox hold the AL's second wildcard spot with a record of 81-68, crucial games ahead.
Bregman hits first home run since August, focuses on finishing strong to secure playoff berth.

title: 3 takeaways from the Revolution’s 1-1 draw vs. Toronto FC
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: The New England Revolution drew 1-1 with Toronto FC at Gillette Stadium, avoiding another home loss thanks to a late equalizer.
Despite the draw, New England remained in 11th place, not officially out of playoff contention due to Chicago's loss.
Allan Oyirwoth made his first MLS start for the Revolution, impressing with his performance at age 18.

title: ‘We should stop talking October’: Alex Cora doesn’t want Red Sox to start thinking about playoffs yet
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox manager Alex Cora advises against focusing on playoffs despite holding a wild-card spot in the American League.
Red Sox have a 90.6% postseason probability, slightly tougher schedule compared to rivals like the Texas Rangers.
Injury to Roman Anthony complicates Boston's lineup decisions against left-handed pitchers, Cora adjusts strategy accordingly.

title: Red Sox CBO Craig Breslow reportedly prioritizing finding a GM this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Craig Breslow, Red Sox CBO, prioritizes hiring a general manager as second-in-command this offseason.
The GM position has been vacant since Breslow's 2024 appointment, with prior GMs having limited influence.
Five assistant GMs, including Raquel Ferreira and Eddie Romero, are potential candidates for the role.

title: Patriots move on from Ja’Lynn Polk, reportedly trading him to Saints
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Patriots traded wide receiver Ja'Lynn Polk to the Saints, receiving a 2027 sixth-round pick and giving up a 2028 seventh-round pick.
Polk, a second-round 2024 NFL Draft pick, struggled with performance and had only 12 receptions for 87 yards and two touchdowns.
Despite being on injured reserve for 2025, Polk was a cut candidate with two seasons left on his rookie contract.
